title: Shopping at Kolkata's Malls (Saurav Mishra)
text: Sep 26, 2015 Icon at New Market - Your shopping experience in the city of Kolkata is not complete if you do not visit New Market. This historical place is made up of a labyrinth of stalls that sell clothes, cosmetics, jewelry, confectionery, undergarments, toys, stationery and the list can go on. Also known as Hogg Market, this place was set up during the British Raj and retains its own charm despite the emergence of many malls and shopping centres. We could not leave this place off our list of places to shop in Kolkata. You would be wise to pay this place a visit. The adjoin Grant street is a haven for fabrics and silks while the Chandni Chowk Market is an electronic and hardware Mecca. South Kolkata Hot Spots - The area of Dhakuria near Gariahat, is home to the Dakshinapan Shopping Centre that sells everything from clothes to handicrafts, junk jewelry to ethnic wear to cosmetics, household products to toiletries and so on. A number of food stalls line the market and dish out local delights like rolls, chow and tea. This market functions from Monday to Saturday and remains closed on Sundays. Pavement to Pavement - Pavemnet shopping doesn't get any better at Chowringhee Road. This entire stretch that starts from Esplanade, covers the space in front of the Oberoi Grand and extends up to the Indian Museum, is lined with stalls that sell clothes, toys, posters, books, toiletries and other stuff. Brands like Bata, Puma, Kolkata Bazar and Timex have outlets along this stretch as well. The noise caused by the hawkers yelling over each other to get the attention of the customers, the cheap deals you get here and the lively atmosphere give this place a sure top spot of our list of places to shop in Kolkata. On a Quest - Quest Mall on Park Circus is a brand lovers haunt. From Mac to Mango; VeroModa to Versace, Canali to Wills Lifestyle and Benetton, this place houses them all under its roof. Add to that an entire level of Inox screens showing the latest flicks and another level dedicated to food stalls like KFC, Pizza Hut, and a list of eateries, Quest is the place to be at. The Lifestyle store comes up with great discounts from time to time and the experience here is what attracts many locals. A New City in South Kolkata - Another great market close to the Prince Anwar Shah, Jadavpur junction is South City Mall. The sheer enormity of the place makes us pen down this market on the list of places to shop in Kolkata. Brand like Marks and Spencers, Rolex, Nike, Westside, and Pantaloons have outlets in the mall. Spread over 5 floors, this mall houses four cinema screens and huge food court that dishes out every possible cuisine one can imagine. About the Author This article is written by Saurav Mishra and makes mention of places for shopping in Kolkata that are awesome spots to shop at. It also highlights what is sold at each place.
